Key Arguments: The legislation would abridge the right to freedom of opinion and expression.
It increases government censorship powers by requiring digital platforms to control and censor information.
The bill creates a bottleneck where the government decides what information is allowed to pass to the public.
The definitions of misinformation and disinformation are subjective, allowing for potential government misuse.
The government has a history of misinformation and censorship, as exemplified by its handling of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Main Themes: Distrust in Government's Role as Information Gatekeeper
Notable Quotes: The Bill seeks to make law to further abridge the right to freedom of opinion and expression.
The proposed Bill will transform Government into a functional bottleneck through which all information passing the Digital Services Platforms must pass.
Government’s aspiration to appoint itself to the role of ‘keeper’ of information transmitted through Digital Platforms is very dangerous.
